main event: A reddish bronze object was observed in the sky over San Francisco, California for approximately 5 minutes on May 14, 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as globe-shaped, about the size of a football held at arm's length.
The object held stationary in the western sky for a few minutes before apparently beginning to disappear at tremendous speed.
The observation was aided by optical means.
The conclusion suggests the object was possibly an astronomical phenomenon, potentially relating to the planet Jupiter.
There was a separate sighting reported in San Francisco in June 1955 describing a bright, pulsing round object with a cone shape.
photographs: yes, the report indicates photos were taken
